page.title: 07ATTITUDES IN NETHERBURY
page.content: Life moves slowly in these friendly villages, work done tomorrow rather than today, except in emergencies when action is prompt. New comers moving into the area are welcomed but cottages sold as second homes or for holiday letting cause some annoyance; bed and breakfast provided in private houses being acceptable. Villagers may grumble over lack of street lighting, vandalism (fairly minor) or street parking but rarely feel strongly enough to take action. All are worried by the loss of amenities such as shop, pub and school fearing the life of the village may wither and young people be unwilling to remain. The newcomers are generally more enthusiastic in supporting social events than the original residents but all turn out on occasions such as the Harvest Supper.
